metadata.title: CVE-2018-12633 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 4.17.2.vbg_misc_device_ioctl() in drivers/virt/vboxguest/vboxguest_linux.c readsthe same user data twice with copy_from_user. The header part of the userdata is double-fetched, and a malicious user thread can tamper with thecritical variables (hdr.size_in and hdr.size_out) in the header between thetwo fetches because of a race condition, leading to severe kernel errors,such as buffer over-accesses. This bug can cause a local denial of serviceand information leakage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12633` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-9.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-9.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1005.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-9.9.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-9.9.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
